battle_log_formatter.description: Formats a battle outcome into a standardized string for easy logging in the notepad.
battle_log_formatter.python_script:
effectiveness_map = {"super effective": ">", "not very effective": "!>", "no effect": "x>"}
symbol = effectiveness_map[input_data["effectiveness"]]
defender_type2_str = f'/{input_data["defender_type2"]}' if input_data.get("defender_type2") else ""

inventory_navigator_tool.description: Calculates the optimal number of button presses (Up/Down) to navigate from a current selection to a target item in a list-based menu. This version correctly handles non-wrapping menus and provides a warning for long scrolls.

check_tile_walkable.description: A diagnostic tool to check if a specific tile is walkable and print its properties for debugging.
check_tile_walkable.python_script:
import xml.etree.ElementTree as ET
import json

x_to_check = int(input_data['x'])
y_to_check = int(input_data['y'])

root = ET.fromstring(map_xml_string)
tile_found = False
for row in root.findall('Row'):
    for tile in row.findall('Tile'):
        coord_str = tile.get('coordinate')
        if not coord_str: continue
        coords = coord_str.strip('()').split(',')
        x = int(coords[0].strip())
        y = int(coords[1].strip())
        if x == x_to_check and y == y_to_check:
            tile_found = True
            attributes = tile.attrib
            children = {child.tag: child.attrib for child in tile}
            print(json.dumps({'found': True, 'attributes': attributes, 'children': children}))
            break
    if tile_found:
        break

if not tile_found:
    print(json.dumps({'found': False, 'message': f'Tile at ({x_to_check},{y_to_check}) not found in XML.'}))
